hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Fade on Failed Volatility Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp, high-volume price breakout (>2.5% move) that fails to hold above its 20-period Bollinger Band (2 std) and is accompanied by a divergence in the RSI (price makes a higher high, RSI makes a lower high) will be followed by a mean reversion move back into the prior range and a high probability transition to a BEAR regime within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral, range-bound markets, liquidity-driven breakouts often fail. A failure at a technical extreme (Bollinger Band) with weakening momentum (RSI divergence) suggests exhaustion among breakout buyers. This creates a 'trap' scenario where late longs are forced to exit, driving price back into the range and potentially catalyzing a shift in market structure toward a bearish bias, especially if macro/news catalysts (like regulatory headlines) are present but not yet price-destructive.
entry_conditions: BTC/USD makes a >2.5% intraday move on volume >120% of 20-day average
Price closes outside the 20-period, 2-standard deviation Bollinger Band
On the subsequent 4-hour candle, price closes back inside the Bollinger Band
4-hour RSI (14) shows bearish divergence (price high > prior high, RSI high < prior high)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 61.8% of the initial breakout move OR regime model shifts to BEAR (confidence > 65%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes >2% above the high of the initial breakout candle
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days after entry without a regime shift to BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals are followed by a continuation of the breakout move and a transition to a BULL regime instead.
